analysis.narrative:
ðŸ“Š **Consensus:** Market sentiment is MIXED with medium conviction. Bullish sources (Twitter 78%, YouTube analysts on capex) emphasize forward-looking tailwinds (AI adoption, capital spending, regulatory easing), while bearish sources (Professional trader 87% bearish, RSS News 50/50) point to present-tense weakness: crypto underperformance despite bullish narrative, crude oil weakness, software guidance misses, and year-end liquidation pressure. The disconnect between bullish consensus and negative price action in risk assets suggests vulnerability.

ðŸ“ˆ **Themes:** (1) **Liquidity & Liquidation Risk** â€” Year-end profit-taking, low holiday volume, and margin call cascades creating downside momentum despite bullish sentiment; (2) **Policy Uncertainty** â€” Geopolitical escalation (China-Taiwan), banking regulatory tightening, and macro policy trajectory creating macro headwinds that offset near-term rate-cut optimism; (3) **Earnings Reality vs. Forward Expectations** â€” Enterprise software guidance misses, regulatory capital impacts, and sector-specific deterioration conflicting with structural AI/capex bull narrative.

ðŸŽ¯ **Levels:** SPY ($690.31): Call Wall $700 (146k OI - ACTIVE hedging at 1.4% away), Put Wall $640 (153k OI - dormant at 7.3% away). Max Pain $687. Near support: $670 (45k OI - ACTIVE at 2.9%), $645 (126k OI - dormant). QQQ ($623.89): Call Wall $630 (33k OI - ACTIVE at 1.0%), Put Wall $590 (164k OI - dormant at 5.4%). Max Pain $620. Near resistance: $640 (31k OI - ACTIVE), $625 (29k OI - ACTIVE). Per Twitter: Crude oil support at WTI below $58/barrel, Brent at $61.67/barrel; Bitcoin 7% YTD decline despite bullish rhetoric.
key_themes: Year-End Liquidation Pressure & Low Holiday Volume
Geopolitical Risk & Policy Uncertainty (China-Taiwan, Banking Regulation)
AI/Capex Bull Narrative vs. Earnings Reality Deterioration
Margin Call Cascades in Crypto/Leveraged Assets
risk_factors: Forced liquidations in crypto and leveraged positions cascading into broader equities
Geopolitical escalation (China-Taiwan, Russia-Ukraine) triggering risk-off deleveraging
Software/enterprise earnings misses and guidance cuts extending into 2026, undermining AI narrative
Banking regulatory tightening reducing leverage/capital availability for market participants
Consensus bullish positioning vulnerable to crowding if near-term data disappoints
analysis.intraday_levels: SPY: Watch $700 call wall (active resistance); support at $670 (active, 2.9% below). QQQ: Resistance at $630 call wall and $625 (both active); breakdown below $625 tests dormant $620 max pain and $590 put wall. Crude oil weakness and liquidation cascades favor downside pressure into year-end.
analysis.swing_levels: SPY 1-5 day: Resistance $700-$730 (call wall + dormant levels); Support $670-$645 (active to dormant put wall). Break of $670 support could cascade to $640-$645. QQQ: Resistance $625-$640 (active call walls); support $620 (max pain, psychological), $590 (major put wall). Sideways-to-negative bias through year-end unless capital spending data or geopolitical de-escalation reverses momentum.

regime.label: NEUTRAL
regime.summary: Market is lacking clear direction. Wait for confirmation.

action.summary: NEUTRAL: No clear edge. Cash is a position.
